front.title: IANA Allocation Guidelines for the PPP Bandwidth Allocation Protocol (BAP)

abstract.t: This document specifies the IANA guidelines for allocating new values in the PPP Bandwidth Allocation and Bandwidth Allocation Control Protocols.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: This document specifies the IANA guidelines for allocating new values for various fields in the PPP Bandwidth Allocation Protocol (BAP) and Bandwidth Allocation Control Protocol (BACP) . BACP is the control protocol for BAP, and is used to manage the dynamic bandwidth allocation of implementations supporting the PPP multilink protocol .

The IANA guidelines are given in . Previously, no IANA guidance existed for such allocations either in or . The purpose of this document is to allow IANA to manage number assignments based on these guidelines in a consistent manner. This document also points to which allows the construction of vendor-specific packets and options.

section.title: IANA Considerations
section.t: The IANA is instructed to create the following registries. For all the registries, new values can be allocated through RFC Required .
IANA is instructed to create a registry for the BACP option values. The initial contents of the registry should be as follows:

figure.artwork:
Registry Name: PPP BACP Configuration Option Types Reference: [RFC2125 and XXX THIS RFC] Registration Procedures: RFC Required
Type Configuration Option Reference ---- -------------------- --------- 0 Vendor-Specific [RFC2153] 1 Favored-Peer [RFC2125] 2-255 Unassigned

section.t: IANA is also instructed to create a registry for the BAP Type field. The initial contents of the registry should be as follows:

figure.artwork:
Registry Name: PPP BAP Type Reference: [RFC2125 and XXX THIS RFC] Registration Procedures: RFC Required
Type Configuration Option Reference ---- -------------------- --------- 0 Vendor-Specific [RFC 2153] 1 Call-Request [RFC 2125] 2 Call-Response [RFC 2125] 3 Callback-Request [RFC 2125] 4 Callback-Response [RFC 2125] 5 Link-Drop-Query-Request [RFC 2125] 6 Link-Drop-Query-Response [RFC 2125] 7 Call-Status-Indication [RFC 2125] 8 Call-Status-Response [RFC 2125] 9-255 Unassigned

section.t: IANA is also instructed to create a registry for the BAP Response Code field. The initial contents of the registry should be as follows:

figure.artwork:
Registry Name: PPP BAP Response Code Reference: [RFC2125 and XXX THIS RFC] Registration Procedures: RFC Required
Type Configuration Option Reference ---- -------------------- --------- 0 Request-Ack [RFC 2125] 1 Request-Nak [RFC 2125] 2 Request-Rej [RFC 2125] 3 Request-Full-Nak [RFC 2125] 4-255 Unassigned

section.t: IANA is also instructed to create a registry for the BAP Datagram Option Type field. The initial contents of the registry should be as follows:

figure.artwork:
Registry Name: PPP BAP Datagram Option Type Reference: [RFC2125 and XXX THIS RFC] Registration Procedures: RFC Required
Type Configuration Option Reference ---- -------------------- --------- 0 Vendor-Specific [RFC 2153] 1 Link-Type [RFC 2125] 2 Phone-Delta [RFC 2125] 3 No-Phone-Number-Needed [RFC 2125] 4 Reason [RFC 2125] 5 Link-Discriminator [RFC 2125] 6 Call-Status [RFC 2125] 7-255 Unassigned

section.t: IANA is also instructed to create a registry for the BAP Link Type field. The initial contents of the registry should be as follows:

figure.artwork:
Registry Name: PPP BAP Link Type Reference: [RFC2125 and XXX THIS RFC] Registration Procedures: RFC Required
Type Configuration Option Reference ---- -------------------- --------- 0 ISDN [RFC 2125] 1 X.25 [RFC 2125] 2 analog [RFC 2125] 3 switched digital (non-ISDN) [RFC 2125] 4 ISDN data over voice [RFC 2125] 5-7 Unassigned

section.t: Note that values 5-7 were originally marked reserved , but this RFC makes them available for allocation.
IANA is also instructed to create a registry for the BAP Phone-Delta Sub-Option Type field. The initial contents of the registry should be as follows:

figure.artwork:
Registry Name: PPP BAP Phone-Delta Sub-Option Type Reference: [RFC2125 and XXX THIS RFC] Registration Procedures: RFC Required
Type Configuration Option Reference ---- -------------------- --------- 0 Vendor-Specific [RFC 2153] 1 Unique-Digits [RFC 2125] 2 Subscriber-Number [RFC 2125] 3 Phone-Number-Sub-Address [RFC 2125] 4-255 Unassigned

section.t: IANA is also instructed to create a registry for the BAP Call Status field. The initial contents of the registry should be as follows:

figure.artwork:
Registry Name: PPP BAP Call Status Reference: [RFC2125 and XXX THIS RFC] Registration Procedures: RFC Required
Type Configuration Option Reference ---- -------------------- --------- 0 Success [RFC 2125] 1-254 Q.931 values [RFC 2125] [ITU.Q931.1993] 255 Other [RFC 2125]

section.t: IANA is also instructed to create a registry for the BAP Call Action field. The initial contents of the registry should be as follows:

figure.artwork:
Registry Name: PPP BAP Call Action Reference: [RFC2125 and XXX THIS RFC] Registration Procedures: RFC Required
Type Configuration Option Reference ---- -------------------- --------- 0 No retry [RFC 2125] 1 Retry [RFC 2125] 2-255 Unassigned

section.title: Security Considerations
section.t: This specification does not change the security properties of BAP or BACP.

section.title: Acknowledgments
section.t: The lack of any registration procedures has come up in IANA's review of existing registries and RFCs.

section.title: Changes from the Original RFCs
section.t: This document specifies only the IANA rules associated with various fields in BAP and BACP, and does not change the operation of the protocols themselves.
